method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates a new discount code for a specific event. It returns the ID of the newly created discount code.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID. The event must have been previously created using /event_new.

param.name: code
param.doc: The discount code. Spaces, apostrophes and non-alphanumeric characters are not allowed, except for dashes and underscores. Examples: “earlybirdspecial_08″, “membersonly”, “dc121232″.

param.name: amount_off
param.doc: The fixed amount off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

param.name: percent_off
param.doc: The percentage off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

param.name: tickets
param.doc: Comma-separated list of ticket IDs for which the discount applies. If not provided, the discount will apply to all ticket types.

param.name: quantity_available
param.doc: Maximum number of times this discount can be used. If not provided, no maximum is set.

param.name: start_date
param.doc: The discount start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: end_date
param.doc: The discount end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method is used to update an existing discount code. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. This method returns the ID of the modified discount code.

param.name: id
param.doc: The discount ID to update.

param.name: code
param.doc: The discount code. Spaces, apostrophes and non-alphanumeric characters are not allowed, except for dashes and underscores. Examples: “earlybirdspecial_08″, “membersonly”, “dc121232″.

param.name: amount_off
param.doc: The fixed amount off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

param.name: percent_off
param.doc: The percentage off the ticket price. Each discount code can have a fixed discount amount or a variable (percentage) discount amount, but not both.

param.name: tickets
param.doc: Comma-separated list of ticket IDs for which the discount applies. If not provided, the discount will apply to all ticket types.

param.name: quantity_available
param.doc: Maximum number of times this discount can be used. If not provided, no maximum is set.

param.name: start_date
param.doc: The discount start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: end_date
param.doc: The discount end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method duplicates an existing event, returning the ID of the new event.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the existing event.

param.name: event_name
param.doc: A new name for this copy of the Event. 255 character limit.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method returns the data for a given event. Only public events are viewable if no authentication is passed.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the requested event.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method returns a list of attendees for a given event. If no authentication is passed, only publicly available attendee records will be returned.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the event.

param.name: count
param.doc: Limit the number of attendees returned. Default limit is 50 attendees per page if paginate selected.

param.name: page
param.doc: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Page size will be setted with “count” parameter.

param.name: do_not_display
param.doc: Comma separated list without spaces that leaves out certain data returned. Valid options are: profile,answers,address. Optional.

param.name: show_full_barcodes
param.doc: If set to ‘true’, it will return all barcodes associates with the attendee, plus the barcode status, device used, attendee_id, and barcode number. If left blank, it will return a comma separated list of barcodes. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method returns a list of discounts for a given event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates a new event. It returns the ID of the newly created event.

param.name: title
param.doc: The event title. 255 characters max.

param.name: description
param.doc: The event description. Optional.

param.name: start_date
param.doc: The event start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: end_date
param.doc: The event end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: timezone
param.doc: The event time zone in relation to GMT (e.g., “GMT+01″, “GMT+02″, “GMT-01″).

param.name: privacy
param.doc: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event. If not provided, will default to 0. Optional.

param.name: personalized_url
param.doc: The event registration URL. If you pass “testevent”, the event will be accessible at “http://testevent.eventbrite.com”. This string is limited to 255 characters max. Optional.

param.name: venue_id
param.doc: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new. Optional.

param.name: organizer_id
param.doc: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new. Optional.

param.name: capacity
param.doc: The maximum number of people who can attend the event. Optional.

param.name: currency
param.doc: The event currency in ISO 4217 format (e.g., “USD”, “EUR”). Optional.

param.name: status
param.doc: The event status. Allowed values are “draft”, “live” for new events. If not provided, status will be “draft”, meaning that the event registration page will not be available publicly. Optional.

param.name: custom_header
param.doc: Custom HTML header for your registration page. Optional.

param.name: custom_footer
param.doc: Custom HTML footer for your registration page. Optional.

param.name: background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: title_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: box_background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: box_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: box_border_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: box_header_background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

param.name: box_header_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method uses our search index to find publicly listed events.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. To run an OR search, you need this format: “keywords=google%20OR%20multimedia”. Optional.

param.name: category
param.doc: Event categories (comma seperated): conference, conventions, entertainment, fundraisers, meetings, other, performances, reunions, sales, seminars, social, sports, tradeshows, travel, religion, fairs, food, music, recreation. Optional.

param.name: address
param.doc: The venue address. Optional.

param.name: city
param.doc: The venue city. Optional.

param.name: region
param.doc: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses. Optional.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal/zip code of the venue. Optional.

param.name: country
param.doc: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format. Optional.

param.name: within
param.doc: If “within” is set and the “city” or “zipcode” resolve to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified within radius. The sorting default will be set to “distance”. Optional.

param.name: within_unit
param.doc: If within is set, you can specify the unit to use: “M” for miles, or “K” for kilometers. By default, the API will use miles. Optional.

param.name: latitude
param.doc: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

param.name: longitude
param.doc: If “within” is set you can limit your search to wgs84 coordinates (latitude, longitude). Optional.

param.name: date
param.doc: The event start date. Limit the list of results to a date range, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

param.name: date_created
param.doc: The date range the event was created, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

param.name: date_modified
param.doc: The date range the event was modified, specified by a label or by exact dates. Currently supported labels include: “All”, “Future”, “Past”, “Today”, “Yesterday”, “Last Week”, “This Week”, “Next week”, “This Month”, “Next Month” and months by name, e.g. “October”. Exact date ranges take the form “YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD”, e.g. “2008-04-25 2008-04-27″. Optional.

param.name: organizer
param.doc: The organizer name. Optional.

param.name: max
param.doc: Limit the number of events returned. Maximum limit is 100 events per page. Default is 10. Optional.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: Only return the total number of events (“true” or “false”). Default is “false”. Optional.

param.name: sort_by
param.doc: Sort the list of events by “id”, “date”, “name”, “city”. The default is “date”. Optional.

param.name: page
param.doc: Allows for paging through the results of a query. Default is 1. Optional.

param.name: since_id
param.doc: Returns events with id greater than “since_id” value. Default is 1. Optional.

param.name: tracking_link
param.doc: The tracking link code to add to the event URLs. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method updates an existing event. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. This method returns the ID of the modified event.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the event to update.

param.name: title
param.doc: The event title. 255 characters max.

param.name: description
param.doc: The event description.

param.name: start_date
param.doc: The event start date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: end_date
param.doc: The event end date and time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″).

param.name: timezone
param.doc: The event time zone in relation to GMT (e.g., “GMT+01″, “GMT+02″, “GMT-01″) or US Time Zone (“PT” or “US/Pacific”, “MT” or “US/Mountain”, “CT” or “US/Central” or “ET” or “US/Eastern”).

param.name: privacy
param.doc: 0 for a private event, 1 for a public event.

param.name: personalized_url
param.doc: The event registration URL subdomain. Your event will be available at http://<personalized_url>.eventbrite.com. This string is limited to 255 characters max.

param.name: venue_id
param.doc: The event venue ID. The venue must have been previously created using /venue_new.

param.name: organizer_id
param.doc: The event organizer ID. The organizer must have been previously created using /organizer_new.

param.name: capacity
param.doc: The maximum number of people who can attend the event.

param.name: currency
param.doc: The event currency in ISO 4217 format (e.g., “USD”, “EUR”).

param.name: status
param.doc: The event status. Allowed values are “draft”, “live” for new events.

param.name: custom_header
param.doc: Custom HTML header for your registration page.

param.name: custom_footer
param.doc: Custom HTML footer for your registration page.

param.name: background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: title_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: box_background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: box_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: box_border_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: box_header_background_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

param.name: box_header_text_color
param.doc: Custom hexadecimal color for your registration page. Format: FFFFFF *without* the pound.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method returns a list of events for a given organizer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The organizer id.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Many event creators prefer having a specific person identified as the point of contact for their event. This person is usually someone like the event emcee, or an on-site contact that can help with attendee check-ins or other issues during the event. This method creates a new organizer, and returns the organizer_id for the newly created resource.

param.name: name
param.doc: The organizer name.

param.name: description
param.doc: The organizer description. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method updates an existing organizer. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated organizer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The organizer ID.

param.name: name
param.doc: The organizer name.

param.name: description
param.doc: The organizer description.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates or updates the payment options for this event. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the list of active methods of payment.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: accept_paypal
param.doc: Accept PayPal payments (1 or 0).

param.name: paypal_email
param.doc: Your PayPal email. Defaults to the user email address if not provided.

param.name: accept_google
param.doc: Accept Google Checkout payments (1 or 0).

param.name: google_merchant_id
param.doc: Google Checkout Merchant ID. Required if accept_google is 1.

param.name: google_merchant_key
param.doc: Google Checkout Merchant Key. Required if accept_google is 1.

param.name: accept_check
param.doc: Accept “Pay by Check” payments (1 or 0).

param.name: instructions_check
param.doc: Instructions to attendees who want to pay by check.

param.name: accept_cash
param.doc: Accept “Pay by Cash” payments (1 or 0).

param.name: instructions_cash
param.doc: Instructions to attendees who want to pay by cash.

param.name: accept_invoice
param.doc: Accept “Send an Invoice” payments (1 or 0).

param.name: instructions_invoice
param.doc: Instructions to attendees who need to be sent an invoice.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates new fixed-price or donation ticket types. It returns the ID of the newly created ticket.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID. The event must have been previously created using /event_new.

param.name: is_donation
param.doc: 0 for fixed-price tickets, 1 for donations. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

param.name: name
param.doc: The ticket name.

param.name: description
param.doc: The ticket description. Optional.

param.name: price
param.doc: The ticket price. Enter 0.00 for free tickets. Leave blank for a donation.

param.name: quantity
param.doc: The number of tickets available. Not required for donations.

param.name: start_sales
param.doc: The date and time when ticket sales start, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

param.name: end_sales
param.doc: The date and time when ticket sales stop, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

param.name: include_fee
param.doc: 0 to add the Eventbrite service fee on top of ticket price, or 1 to include it in the ticket price. 0 will be used by default if not provided. Optional.

param.name: min
param.doc: The minimum number of tickets per order. Optional.

param.name: max
param.doc: The maximum number of tickets per order. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method updates an existing ticket type. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated ticket.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ticket ID.

param.name: is_donation
param.doc: 0 for fixed-price tickets, 1 for donations.

param.name: name
param.doc: The ticket name.

param.name: description
param.doc: The ticket description.

param.name: price
param.doc: The ticket price. Enter 0.00 for free tickets. Leave blank for a donation. If tickets are already sold, price will not change.

param.name: quantity
param.doc: The number of tickets available. Not required for donations.

param.name: start_sales
param.doc: The date and time when ticket sales start, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

param.name: end_sales
param.doc: The date and time when ticket sales stop, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., “2007-12-31 23:59:59″). Optional.

param.name: include_fee
param.doc: 0 to add the Eventbrite service fee on top of ticket price, or 1 to include it in the ticket price.

param.name: min
param.doc: The minimum number of tickets per order.

param.name: max
param.doc: The maximum number of tickets per order.

param.name: hide
param.doc: Show or hide the ticket type. Valid options: (y or n)

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method returns the user account identified by the user_id or email request parameters. Visibility is limited to users and sub-users of the given user_key.

param.name: user_id
param.doc: The ID of the subuser account. Optional.

param.name: email
param.doc: The email address of the subuser account. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method lists the events created by this user. Only public events are returned if no authentication is passed.

param.name: email
param.doc: The user email. Defaults to the authenticated user if not provided. Optional.

param.name: do_not_display
param.doc: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: description, venue, logo, style, organizer, tickets. Example: "do_not_display=venue,logo,style". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Optional.

param.name: event_statuses
param.doc: Comma separated list without spaces. Valid options include: live, started, ended. Example: "event_statuses=live,started". If you leave this field blank, it will return everything. Also note that the “ended” option will only return events that have ended in the last 7 days. Optional.

param.name: asc_or_desc
param.doc: Valid options include ‘asc’ or results in ascending order or ‘desc’ or descending order based on event start_date. Defaults to asc. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method lists the organizers created by this user. Requires authentication.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method lists the tickets purchased by the authenticated user. Each transaction is an order in our system and an order may contain one or more tickets. Tickets to free events are included.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method lists the venues created by this user. Requires authentication.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates a new user, returning the user’s ID in the response.

param.name: email
param.doc: The user email address.

param.name: passwd
param.doc: The user password. (needs to be at least 4 characters long).

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method updates an existing user. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated user.

param.name: new_email
param.doc: New user email address.

param.name: new_password
param.doc: New user password. (needs to be at least 4 characters long).

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method creates a new venue. It returns the ID of the newly created venue.

param.name: organizer_id
param.doc: The ID of the related organizer.

param.name: venue
param.doc: The venue name.

param.name: adress
param.doc: The venue address (line 1). Optional.

param.name: adress_2
param.doc: The venue address (line 2). Optional.

param.name: city
param.doc: The venue city. Optional.

param.name: region
param.doc: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal code of the venue. Optional.

param.name: country_code
param.doc: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This method updates an existing venue. Only the fields passed as arguments will be modified. It returns the ID of the updated venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The venue ID.

param.name: venue
param.doc: The venue name.

param.name: adress
param.doc: The venue address (line 1).

param.name: adress_2
param.doc: The venue address (line 2).

param.name: city
param.doc: The venue city.

param.name: region
param.doc: The venue state/province/county/territory depending on the country. 2-letter state code is required for US addresses.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal code of the venue.

param.name: country_code
param.doc: 2-letter country code, according to the ISO 3166 format.
